source.6e45b0b9:
from google.cloud import bigquery

client = bigquery.Client()
source.efd02627:
query = """
SELECT country_code, COUNT(*) AS cnt
FROM `patents-public-data.patents.publications`
GROUP BY country_code;
"""

df = client.query(query).to_dataframe()
df.head(20)
source.c5097e49: Kaggle can access data in BigQuery. If you do not set a Google Cloud project ID, you will be using the Kaggle BigQuery client with 5TB query quota per month free. This client can access any public BigQuery dataset.
